Name: Coffin
Description: A fine mummiform coffin, painted black with yellow decoration. The face is particularly finely modelled. The owner of the coffin remains anonymous, the spaces for the insertion of the name have been left blank. Along either side of the lid is a single horizontal line of inscription, the htp-dj-nsw invoking Osiris. Across the chest is depicted the vulture goddess Nekhbet with wings spread, holding hieroglyphic shen-rings in her talons, below her is a single column of hieroglyphs, intended to be an utterance by the deceased. From either side of this column four pairs of evenly spaced bands of inscription contain utterances by various deities. The four Sons of Horus are depicted around the sides.
